title: The Affine model with MI is not satisfying for CT/MR co-registration
body:
Thank you in advance for your time and energy spent to maintain the issues updated!

I used the Affine model of voxelmorph with 8-bin Mutual-Information loss function for 2D CT/MR co-registration. The base-net architecture is as [32, 32, 32, 32, 16, 6] where 6 refers to the fully-connected last layer, and the other early layers are exactly like with the Affine model of voxelmorph. Here is some paired CT/MR slices:

http://s6.picofile.com/file/8392190192/myplot1.png

The model trained with adam (lr=1e-4) for 1000 epochs on 731 2D CT/MR pairs (80 ones for validation). The history is as follows:

http://s6.picofile.com/file/8392190242/MI8_ep1000.png

But, finally, the outcome was not satisfying both on the validation and test data, like the followings:

A validation data: http://s6.picofile.com/file/8392190226/1_val.png
A test data: http://s7.picofile.com/file/8392190234/2_test.png

I do not know why?! but the model with 'mse' loss function on 500 epochs was more satisfiable, though we are speaking about multimodal registration. I should note that both the train (val), and test data contain both T1 and T2 MRIs to make the problem more challenging, yet with image normalization we have done as a pre-processing, it should not be the source of problem, I am not sure. 

As a random guess, I am suspicious about MI loss with only 8 bins, and what do you think about 16 bins (unfortunately, the system cannot progress with more bins). 

Your help is highly appreciated. Thanks and regards.
